Context:
The Electronics Technician program at this college is presented in 24 modules, with prerequisites including an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, or mature student status, and an electronics background is helpful but not essential. Students who have completed the Electromechanical Technician program are exempted from 18 modules. The minimum computer requirements include a Pentium-based processor, 2 GB RAM, 500 MB of available disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11, and an email account with internet access. Graduates will be prepared to work as service technicians on electronic products and equipment.

Credits from this program may be applied to various postgraduate studies including the Electronics Engineering Technician diploma program at George Brown College, Bachelor of Science in Technology Management degree at Indiana State University, Bachelor of Science degree at Athabasca University, and Bachelor of Science in Organizational Studies degree at Neumann University.

Required courses include: ELNC 9034 - Introduction to Electronics, ELCL 9049 - Current, Voltage and Resistance, ELCL 9050 - Ohmâ€™s Law, Power and Energy, ELCL 9048 - Series Circuits, ELCL 9047 - Parallel Circuits, ELCL 9046 - Series-Parallel Circuits, ELNC 9036 - DC Measuring Instruments, and ELCL 9045 - Network Theorems.

The modules should be taken in the following order.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Electronics Technician Program (Distance Education) T901 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Electronics Technician program at George Brown College offers various courses under ELCL (Electrical & Computer Engineering Technology - Line) and ELNC (Electrical & Computer Engineering Technology - Networking) categories. Some of the courses include "Network Theorems", "Alternating Voltages and Currents", "Capacitance and Capacitors", "Inductance and Inductors", "Transformers", "Alternating Current Circuits", "Resonance", "Coupling and Filter Circuits", "Transistors and Thyristors", "Amplifier Circuits", "Integrated Circuits", "Digital Electronics", "Microprocessors". The tuition for domestic students is CA$1,760.00* for the entire program, while there is no additional cost for international students. The tuition can be paid in full or using a pay-as-you-learn option. International applicants are charged the same fees but in U.S. dollars. Students need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (or equivalent) or mature student status to apply.
    
*The amounts listed are for the programs starting in fall 2023, and fees are subject to change for later dates.
    
No financial assistance is available for this program, and the information provided is subject to change without notice.
